qas.question: How many guns or missile launchers are typically in a battery?
In addition to guns or missile launchers, what else comprises the battery?
Where do batteries typically get deployed?
Which missile batteries often have individual launchers several kilometres from one another?
Several dozen teams can deploy individually in small sections when what is handled by a specialist?

context: The basic air defence unit is typically a battery with <a0_0>2 to 12<a0_0/> guns or missile launchers and <a1_0>fire control elements<a1_0/>. These batteries, particularly with guns, usually deploy <a2_0>in a small area<a2_0/>, although batteries may be split; this is usual for some missile systems. <a3_0>SHORAD<a3_0/> missile batteries often deploy across an area with individual launchers several kilometres apart. When <a4_0>MANPADS<a4_0/> is operated by specialists, batteries may have several dozen teams deploying separately in small sections; self-propelled air defence guns may deploy in pairs.
